title: Are you going to listen to your community about Fiora's new VU? I highly reccomend you do.
body:
Riot, I can understand your position. "We already had people do the art and models". But that shouldn't stop you. There isn't a huge rush about it. It is better to have it done right than locking in something people don't like.

Fiora's in-game models and artworks are not in need of a VU. All she would need is to have her textures changed a little bit on her skins. That is literally all you have to do.

Everybody is talking about it Riot. Please don't let me down and blow it. People have been complaining about a lot of things you guys have done with the game recently. I think it is in your best interest to listen to them.

Do the right thing. Just give her a texture update. Do not edit her model and splash arts.

To me, this looks like a literal downgrade.

EDIT: Despite all of the negative feedback over her appearance, she didn't get changed. Shocking.

That's fucking dumb then. By voting to disagreement, you're suppressing unpopular opinions, thus killing any possible discourse or debate, and in the end you just turn the boards into a giant circlejerk.

Maybe I should go into my logic a little bit more:

* If someone says something I flat out disagree with, but doesn't support it, it gets a ***down vote*** ("G&B should be limited to Diamond Players only")
* If someone says something I flat out agree with, but doesn't support it, it's 50/50 on if I'll ***up vote*** it. It depends on how I'm feeling. ("AP Ezreal is the Best Ezreal!")
* If someone says something I flat out disagree with, provides pretty good reasoning for it, and afterwards I still flat out disagree with it, they get a ***no vote*** from me. They've done nothing to deserve a down vote, but they haven't done enough to deserve an up vote either.
* If someone says something I flat out disagree with, provides good reasoning for it, and gets me to be more sympathetic to their position, they get an ***up vote***. I may not end up changing my stance, but they've at least helped me understand, and that's worth something.
* If someone says something I agree with, and supports it, they get an ***up vote***.
* If someone says something that's wrong, I typically ***down vote*** it. No need to spread false information.
* If someone says something that's right, I ***up vote*** it. Spreading correct information is good.

With that as my general rubric, I do not, as you suggest, suppress discourse or debate. 

As you might have guess, your post on the actual purpose of votes got a down vote from me, because it is spreading false information. That said, the down vote spawned a larger discussion (me explaining why you're wrong). I accomplish the same goals you look to promote, but with a different way of voting.
Those two are not even close to being mutually exclusive.  You know?
Yes, but right now, it's being used to suppress different opinions, if you do not agree that the Fiora VU is bad, you're getting downvoted.

Yep, that's what happens when you go against popular opinion on reworks.  People think any kind of positive feedback will harm the negative image of the rework, I believe.

Their fears aren't entirely unfounded, though, and I think that's a pretty major issue.
